intro: Cestichis philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine cestichis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It often grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
